thread.section_title: UK News on The Huffington Post
thread.title: Daily Mail And Nigel Farage Angered By MPs Who Voted Against Brexit
thread.title_full: Daily Mail And Nigel Farage Angered By MPs Who Voted Against Brexit

author: Graeme Demianyk
title: Daily Mail And Nigel Farage Angered By MPs Who Voted Against Brexit
text:
Daily Mail And Nigel Farage Angered By MPs Who Voted Against Brexit 'Enemies of democracy' who 'betray will of the people', apparently. 01/02/2017 23:50 Graeme Demianyk Night News Editor and US-Based Reporter, The Huffington Post UK 
The inevitable fall-out from t he parliamentary vote paving the way for Brexit has started, with The Daily Mail accusing MPs who voted against legislation of “betrayal” and Nigel Farage labelling them “enemies of democracy”. 
The European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Bill, which will allow Theresa May to start the Brexit process, cleared its first parliamentary hurdle by a vote in the Commons of 498 to 114. 
The vote was embarrassing for Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn as 47 of his MPs ( full list here ) rebelled against a three-line whip and vote against triggering Article 50. The vote was hailed by the eurosceptic Mail, which has been a vocal cheerleader of the UK quitting the European Union for years. MAIL: We have lift off! #tomorrowspaperstoday pic.twitter.com/VuStZA8WC9 — Neil Henderson (@hendopolis) February 1, 2017 
In its sub-headline, the newspaper suggested MPs who trotted through the ‘no’ lobby had tempered its joy, declaring: “114 MPs betray will of the people.” 
Former Ukip leader Nigel Farage echoed the sentiment, arguing the “114 enemies of democracy should be made to pay the price at the ballot box”. Here is a list of 114 enemies of democracy who should be made to pay the price at the ballot box. https://t.co/WgVe4d4F1t — Nigel Farage (@Nigel_Farage) February 1, 2017 
The charges are reminiscent of a Daily Mail front page in November when three Supreme Court judges were branded “enemies of the people” after the successful Article 50 challenge. 
The Court ruled May cannot trigger Brexit without first consulting Parliament, a decision which left many Leave supporters furious. Daily Mail 
Many of the MPs voting against the ‘Brexit Bill’ argue their constituencies, which they were elected to represent, voted to Remain and are therefore reflecting their wishes. SNP MPs make a similar contention, pointing out Scotland voted against Brexit. 
But not all of them represent Remain areas. Labour MP Chris Bryant, whose South Wales constituency voted to Leave, said in the Commons he was “voting and speaking on behalf of a minority of my constituents”. As I said in chamber today, this country was built on the sweat,courage and ingenuity of migrants who wanted to help make this country great pic.twitter.com/LhdpbN18BW — Chris Bryant MP (@RhonddaBryant) February 1, 2017 
MPs responded to the charges on Twitter. The SNP’s John Nicolson took Farage to task, urging the MEP - who has failed six times to become an MP - to challenge him in his East Dunbartonshire constituency. Feel free to stand against me Nigel. Nothing would give me more pleasure than exposing your cant and bluster in a campaign. https://t.co/9TX5brz4RR — JOHN NICOLSON M.P. (@MrJohnNicolson) February 1, 2017 
Meanwhile, Labour’s Stella Creasy was condemned by Ukip donor and Farage associate Arron Banks. The people voted in a massive exercise of participative democracy. You voted to kick them the in the nether regions! Shame https://t.co/BoztMglX7t — Arron Banks (@Arron_banks) February 1, 2017 
The Walthamstow MP made clear the vote was not about whether Brexit happens. Many are demanding further details on the terms of quitting the EU before giving their consent. Vote wasn't about whether Brexit happens but how. Surprised UKIP wanted to green light giving TM power to choose- what if she reneges? https://t.co/NEfpBvdaeM
